metadata.domain: UK Geography — Counties and Climate Systems

Q01.text: Which national park is primarily located in Cumbria?

Q02.text: What is the capital city of Wales?

Q03.text: In which county is Stonehenge located?

Q04.text: Which mountain is the highest point in Wales?

Q06.text: Why does western Scotland receive significantly more rainfall than eastern Scotland?

options.A: Prevailing westerly winds bring moist Atlantic air
options.C: Eastern mountain ranges create rain shadow

Q07.text: What primarily causes milder winter temperatures along England's SW coast vs inland?

Q08.text: Why does London receive lower annual rainfall than Manchester?

options.B: Pennines create orographic uplift over Manchester
options.C: Pennines create rain shadow protecting London from westerlies
options.D: London urban heat island suppresses precipitation

Q09.text: The North Atlantic Drift primarily affects UK climate by:

options.C: Moderating winter temperatures and increasing precipitation

Q10.text: Why do areas east of the Pennines show more continental climate characteristics?

options.A: Protected from Atlantic air masses by Pennines

Q11.text: A town has 65mm rainfall in January, 48mm in July; 21°C max in July, 4°C in January. Which UK climate type?
A town has 65mm rainfall in January, 48mm in July; 21°C max in July, 4°C in January. Which UK climate type?

Q12.text: A student claims Birmingham gets less rain than Glasgow because it's inland. Which concept best supports this?

options.B: Continental effect / distance from moisture source

Q13.text: A Cornwall farmer worries about climate change impacts. Based on UK climate patterns, what is MOST likely?

options.B: More winter frost from weakening Gulf Stream
options.C: Increased rainfall variability and milder winters

Q14.text: Yorkshire has a rain shadow on its eastern side. What does this mean for East Yorkshire agriculture?

Q15.text: A Newcastle planner assesses flood risk. Given its East-Pennine position and River Tyne proximity, which factor is prioritised?

options.A: Orographic precipitation from westerlies crossing Pennines
options.B: North Sea storm surge + River Tyne discharge
options.C: Urban heat island intensifying convective rainfall
